comment: The personal dashboard created on the app in the PC appears in an archaic font and i struggle to scroll it down without it going to a random quote in the list. That's very irritating.

title: Guest access cancelled

comment: News, stocks, fixed income, funds! You name it they have it - you make fast decision by the way they present data!!  MUST HAVE!!
title: Best app ever!!

comment: Disappointing that they've cancelled guest access especially as I helped the development team with feedback when I was at my previous employer. Will look for other alternatives (probably Bloomberg).

title: Make a standalone eikon message app

comment: New update is really cool..love the mesaanger app

author: Amr Hammad
comment: I don't know what is the problem with reuters. The app is really stupid. The chart is very poor and the indices not in order any more. I get bored
title: Hated it

author: Guillaume van Baalen
comment: This app is so buggy it is ridiculous. It stays active all the time, draining battery, and then claims I'm already logged in, so it won't update unless I force close it 10 TIMES PER DAY.  Oh, and also the app tries to hijack any click on a web link: if you are using the stock browser, any click on a link and you are presented with the option to open it with stupid eikon _or_ the browser that is currently running. MOST ANNOYING, STUPID STUPID STUPID DESIGN.
title: So buggy it is ridiculous.

author: Pasakorn Singhakan
comment: There are all info i seek in one go, very useful
title: Awesome financial app

comment: Good job
title: Excellent

comment: Another crappie news app that never gives you the story you're looking for in a reasonable amount of searches. Done with this crap, I'll just use my data.

author: Development Genesis
comment: A new version always crash.

author: Jazz Choo
comment: Why the stock market statistics is not live anymore? It's doesn't load automatically

reply.author: Thomson Reuters
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback.  The issue with market data not updating automatically has now been resolved.

title: After updated , is bad.

author: Xiaojiao Cheng
comment: wondering if we can add reuters messanger into mobile version which allows traders to share news instantly

reply.author: Thomson Reuters
reply.content: Great suggestion.  We are currently working on integrating Messenger into Eikon for Android.  It should be released later this year (2015).  Stay current on your updates and look for the new functionality!

comment: Very nice app

comment: Best app for news and info!

title: Good app.

author: Doncho Popkrastev
comment: Best financial tool...we'll see!
title: Looks promising

author: Sachin Bhosale
comment: It's good. Need few improvements though.
title: Good

author: Sunny Guo
comment: I seemed to get kicked out of my desktop when I login to the app and vice versa. Can't have them both logged in simultaneously. Really becomes a pain when I run in and out of meetings.

reply.author: Thomson Reuters
reply.content:
Hi Sunny, due to fee liability on the part of the exchanges, we must avoid concurrent real-time sessions from a single account.

Please note, we've introduced a Multi Sign In feature where you can now opt into delayed market data on Android in order to preserve your desktop session and gain simultaneous access.

Many thanks!

title: Having to constantly login between desktop and app

author: Wen
comment: This version has bug. Quote list instrument all jumbled up. Pls fix it!

author: Suyog Shelar
comment: Why not free for Android users

author: Yasser Al-Dawood
comment: Not as functional as the desktop version, but it comes in handy when the latter is out of reach. I would love to see the economic overview included in future versions.
title: A Work in Progress

author: Ghaleb Katat
comment: Acc.Maneger--Practical app. for users.

author: Bryan Czyzewski
comment: Great for on the go quotes and news,  but push alerts are not working for android. Otherwise nice to use to keep am eye on breaking news.

reply.author: Thomson Reuters
reply.content:
Thanks Bryan. 

Please note, once Alerts are defined within the desktop, they'll automatically sync to your Android device (provided you have push notifications enabled).

title: Decent app, needs to iron out bugs
